text: At the end of every seven years you must declare a cancellation of debts.

This is the nature of the cancellation: Every creditor must remit what he has loaned to another person; he must not force payment from his fellow Israelite, for it is to be recognized as “the Lord’s cancellation of debts.”

You may <st data-num="05065" class="">exact payment from</st> a <st data-num="05237" class="">foreigner</st>, but <st data-num="0834" class="">whatever</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">fellow Israelite</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">owes</st> you, you must <st data-num="08058 03027">remit</st>.
However, there should not be any poor among you, for the Lord will surely bless you in the land that he is giving you as an inheritance,

<st data-num="07535 0518">if</st> you <st data-num="08085" class="">carefully</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">obey</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06963 03068 0430">him</st><n id="2" /> by <st data-num="08104 06213">keeping</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">these</st> <st data-num="04687" class="">commandments</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="06680" class="">giving</st><n id="4" /> you <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st>.
For the Lord your God will bless you just as he has promised; you will lend to many nations but will not borrow from any, and you will rule over many nations but they will not rule over you.
If a fellow Israelite from one of your villages in the land that the Lord your God is giving you should be poor, you must not harden your heart or be insensitive to his impoverished condition.

<st data-num="03588" class="">Instead</st>, you must <st data-num="06605" class="">be sure</st> to <st data-num="06605" class="">open</st> your <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> to him and <st data-num="05670" class="">generously</st> <st data-num="05670" class="">lend</st><n id="1" /> him <st data-num="01767 04270 0834">whatever</st> he <st data-num="02637" class="">needs</st>.<n id="2" />

Be careful lest you entertain the wicked thought that the seventh year, the year of cancellation of debts, has almost arrived, and your attitude be wrong toward your impoverished fellow Israelite and you do not lend him anything; he will cry out to the Lord against you, and you will be regarded as having sinned.
You must by all means lend to him and not be upset by doing it, for because of this the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you attempt.
There will never cease to be some poor people in the land; therefore, I am commanding you to make sure you open your hand to your fellow Israelites who are needy and poor in your land.
If your fellow Hebrew—whether male or female—is sold to you and serves you for six years, then in the seventh year you must let that servant go free.

<st data-num="03588" class="">If</st> you <st data-num="07971 05973">set</st> them <st data-num="02670" class="">free</st>, you must <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> them <st data-num="07971" class="">away</st> <st data-num="07387" class="">empty-handed</st>.
You must supply them generously from your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress—as the Lord your God has blessed you, you must give to them.
Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you; therefore, I am commanding you to do this thing today.

<st data-num="01961" class="">However</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> the servant<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you, “I do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> want to <st data-num="03318 05973">leave</st><n id="2" /> you,” <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> he <st data-num="0157" class="">loves</st> you and your <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">since</st> he is <st data-num="02895" class="">well off</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> you,

you shall <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> an <st data-num="04836" class="">awl</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">pierce a hole</st> through his <st data-num="0241" class="">ear</st> to the <st data-num="01817" class="">door</st>.<n id="1" /> Then he will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="05769" class="">permanently</st> (<st data-num="03651" class="">this</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">applies</st> to your <st data-num="0519" class="">female servant</st> <st data-num="0637" class="">as well</st>).
You should not consider it difficult to let him go free, for he will have served you for six years, twice the time of a hired worker; the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.
You must set apart for the Lord your God every firstborn male born to your herds and flocks. You must not work the firstborn of your bulls or shear the firstborn of your flocks.
You and your household must eat them annually before the Lord your God in the place he chooses.
If one of them has any kind of blemish—lameness, blindness, or anything else—you may not offer it as a sacrifice to the Lord your God.

You may <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> it in your <st data-num="08179" class="">villages</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03162" class="">whether</st> you are <st data-num="02931" class="">ritually impure</st> or <st data-num="02889" class="">clean</st>,<n id="2" /> just as you would eat a <st data-num="06643" class="">gazelle</st> or an <st data-num="0354" class="">ibex</st>.
However, you must not eat its blood; you must pour it out on the ground like water.
